lenders.name: Jennifer
lenders.loan_because: I am blessed to have it. It is my prayer that one day someone else will be the lender and not the  borrower because of my contributions.
lenders.occupational_info: I educate children, however that is my service. My work is to praise God and to be a Christian! Be Blessed!!

lenders.name: Joseph
lenders.occupational_info: Political

lenders.name: misty
lenders.occupation: i make baby slings from hom

lenders.name: Adam
lenders.loan_because: I want to help you create your own happiness

lenders.name: Barbara & Mario
lenders.occupation: Health Education and Disease Prevention Research
lenders.loan_because: Kiva's microloaning program is a great way to plant seeds of economic freedom in families around the world
lenders.occupational_info: Barbara teaches HIV prevention and Mario works in public health doing research and evaluation of chronic diseases like cancer and heart disease.

lenders.name: Kimberly
lenders.loan_because: I want to help people and change the world! We have a choice to help make it a little easier for others, so let's do it.

lenders.name: Ken
lenders.loan_because: Our generation of hope, pioneered by technologies such as kiva, is enabling individuals from vastly different circumstances to realize their interdependence, to empower one another, and to bond as friends.
lenders.occupational_info: I want to suck the marrow out of life. I believe that the better off my fellow neighbor is, the better off I will be. I enjoy life. I have a stake in this world. I am responsible but take no credit.

lenders.name: Terry
lenders.loan_because: members of my Sunday School class told me about the program and it sounded so rewarding.   I am also going to have my sons begin to lend money so they can learn the value of helping others.
lenders.occupational_info: I specialize in training and outreach on programs for the elderly and disabled adults and children to help them stay at home and receive care at home.

lenders.name: Mona
lenders.loan_because: When I saw an ad for Kiva I didn't see how I couldn't give a $25 loan! Now I have been paid back and am giving out the same money again! It's so great that I will be able to help people over and over with the same $25
lenders.occupational_info: I work in a restaurant. When somebody comes in to eat I suggest items they might like and help them choose from our very large wine and drink list. Then I relay their order to the kitchen and/or bar who makes the food and drinks. I talk with the tables, make sure they have all they need and also process their credit card or cash before they leave.

lenders.name: Matthew
lenders.loan_because: I've needed a leg up in my time.
lenders.occupational_info: I design commercial and residential fire sprinkler systems to protect life and property.

lenders.name: Raghu

lenders.name: Socient

lenders.name: Alex
lenders.loan_because: It's a great feeling to be able to help!

lenders.name: kara
lenders.loan_because: People deserve it.
lenders.occupational_info: At my work, I try to be kind, helpful and informative, facilitating people's navigation through the very convoluted world of American health insurance.

lenders.name: Stephanie

lenders.name: Matthew

lenders.name: Kemmeo and Aaron

lenders.occupational_info: I am a photographer, a daughter, a wife, and a mother.

lenders.name: Olina
lenders.loan_because: Even if  I am not a rich girl, I know more and more people stay poor with heavy burden and strong desire to become economically independent.  I hope my little donation will be helpful to others to improve their lives and make a better future for their families and children.
lenders.occupational_info: an average office lady

lenders.occupational_info: The pay-roll company is internet based and with very little training a person can do a whole companies completed pay-roll, as you buy software packages that does all the calculations for you. You just need to have the basic background, a computer and internet. With this and as long as people are getting employed a person always have potential customers.

All ID is dedicated in  provide what customers want - a single source for all of their identification needs: including product, cards, supplies, full service installation, training, network and database services, as well as preventative and emergency on-site maintenance. With factory-trained and certified technicians to provide on site maintenance or depot service with fast turn around on all repairs for you're: ID Card Printers, Card Embossers, Imprinters, Cameras, and Barcode Label Printers
All ID has been in business since 1988, our mission is to provide the best of what the customers want.

I hope that in my life, as I live it and it plays out, that I will be able to make Gene proud!
lenders.occupational_info: I work with small and medium size businesses selling IT product and services to the US Government. lenders.name: Leely
lenders.loan_because:
Gratitude unlocks the fullness of life. It turns what we have into enough, and more. It turns denial into acceptance, chaos to order, confusion to clarity. It can turn a meal into a feast, a house into a home, a stranger into a friend. Gratitude makes sense of our past, brings peace for today, and creates a vision for tomorrow.
-- Melody Beattie

A thankful heart is not only the greatest virtue, but the parent of all other virtues.
-- Cicero

lenders.loan_because: I believe microloans provide a direct means of opening up opportunities and I find it very exciting to know a little bit about the person's life who is a visionary and engaged in making their world a better place.  I also like being part of a team of donors because it symbolizes that we are not alone on this earth.

lenders.name: patti
lenders.loan_because: "I expect to pass through this life but once. If, therefore, there be any kindness I can show, or any good thing I can do for my fellow being, let me do it now.....as I shall not pass this way again." ~~William Penn
lenders.occupational_info: What I do can be summed up a quote written by Phillips Brooks, "The truest help we can render an afflicted man is not to take his burden from him, but to call out his best energy, that he may be able to bear the burden."

lenders.name: Kathryn
lenders.loan_because: I believe a big believer in living the change you want to see in the world
lenders.occupational_info: I'm currently transitioning to a new field.

lenders.name: Jennifer
lenders.loan_because: All that I've read on micro-loans has been positive.  I feel that I can leverage my donation dollars by giving in this fashion.

lenders.loan_because: I want to help women across the globe gain financial independence and be able to create better lives for themselves, their families, and ultimately contribute to the sustainability of their communities.

lenders.loan_because: I come from one of the reachest country in the world and would like to help hard working people in other parts of the world with funding.

lenders.name: Dee
lenders.loan_because: Even when I think my life is tough, I know there are people that are very happy & fullfilled with much less.  And if I can help someone make their lives better, well, that's got to be the best feeling in the world!

lenders.name: Dusty
lenders.loan_because: Kiva is an easy way to help create sustainable employment for people just like me.
lenders.occupational_info: As Executive Director of IsleGO Missions I have the best job in the world, taking short-term missions teams to 10 different countries.

lenders.name: Kristin
lenders.loan_because: I am a follower of Jesus and I believe in the transformative power that microfinance can have on individuals, their families and their communities!
lenders.occupational_info: For 5 months over the past year I traveled the US with an exhibit called the World Vision Experience: AIDS. Now I'm back in the office supporting the tour and working on new product development.

lenders.name: Martina
lenders.loan_because: “Not the sun or the summer alone, but every hour and season yields its tribute of delight; for every hour and change corresponds to a different state of the mind, from breathless noon to grimmest midnight…Crossing a bare common, in snow puddles, at twilight, under a clouded sky, without having in my thoughts any occurrence of special good fortune, I have enjoyed perfect exhilaration.  I am glad to the brink of fear.” –Ralph Waldo Emerson
